body.p: It is highly recommended that Reviewers use some sort of mechanism to indicate that the task review process is finished in your workflow and all files attached to the task should be reviewed before finalizing the task. Otherwise, the Content Author may end up merging changes more than once and this could result in some complicated conflicts.
You might have your own preferred method of letting the Content Author know that you are finished, but includes the following action that is designed specifically for this purpose:

dlentry.dd:
In the Visual Editor page, you can use the Finalize My Review button (located in the top header stripe) to add a predefined message to the task that lets the Content Author know you have reviewed all the files attached and you are finished with the process. You can also add an additional optional message to provide more details.
Using the Finalize My Review button does not delete the task.
You can see all your finalized review tasks by going to the My Review Tasks page (click the Review Tasks button in the top header stripe or select My Review Tasks from the user name drop-down menu in the top-right corner). Then go to the Assigned To Me tab and if the finalized tasks category is not shown, click the Show finalized review tasks link at the bottom of the page.
